alert.note: Alert for Craig; Nowata; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:42AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Craig, northern Rogers, northern Washington and Nowata Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 642 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles southeast of Caney to 2 miles northeast of Talala. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Vinita... Nowata... Dewey... Chelsea... South Coffeyville... Copan... Welch... Delaware... Bluejacket... Lenapah... Talala... Wann... New Alluwe... Watova... White Oak... Hollow... Centrailia... Pyramid Corners... Centralia... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 277 and 292. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
